intro: Urophyllum pubescens, commonly known as the hairy urophyllum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Urophyllum pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
